00001 /*
00002  *    Filename:    mmidefs.h
00003  *
00004  *    Purpose:     Internal definitions for the MM package
00005  *
00006  *    Copyright: C 2008 Sierra Wireless All rights reserved
00007  *
00008  */
00009 
00010 /* Internal Definitions */
00011 
00012 #define MMPOOLVALID 0xDEADBEEF
00013 #define MMSIGNATURE 0xBEEFCAFE
00014 
00015 /*
00016  * Name:    mmbufhdr
00017  *
00018  * Purpose: This structure is the header for individual pool buffers.
00019  *          It resides at the very top of each pool block, behind the
00020  *          pointer a user gets and it always contains valid information
00021  *          about the pool block once the pool has been initialized
00022  *
00023  * Members: mmsignature - A fixed amount of storage containing the same
00024  *                        hexadecimal signature for every block. This
00025  *                        field is checked every time the MM package 
00026  *                        is requested to perform an operation on the 
00027  *                        buffer. If the signature is incorrect then 
00028  *                        an error is declared and the processor is 
00029  *                        brought down
00030  *          mmnextfreep - Pointer to the next free block in the list
00031  *          mmpoolp     - Pointer to the pool structure for the pool
00032  *                        of which this block is a member. When this 
00033  *                        block is released to the free pool, this 
00034  *                        pointer is used to find the appropriate pool
00035  *
00036  * Notes: If the contents of this structure change, make sure the size
00037  *        is always a multiple of 4 bytes. 
00038  *
00039  */
00040 struct mmbufhdr
00041 {
00042     swi_uint32 mmsignature;
00043     struct mmbufhdr *mmnextfreep;
00044     struct mmpool *mmpoolp;
00045 };
00046 
00047 #include "mmiproto.h"
